image.altText: A man and woman move yellow sand bags around their home

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says impacts from Tropical Cyclone Alfred will develop today, with the storm likely to hit north of Brisbane sometime tomorrow.

title.children: Prepare now: Cyclone Alfred expected to make landfall by Friday morning

image.altText: beach waves forming

props.synopsis: Brisbane City Council issues a "prepare to evacuate" call to action for areas within the possible storm surge zone ahead of Cyclone Alfred's crossing.

title.children: Brisbane bayside suburbs told to prepare to evacuate as cyclone approaches

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks outside the Queensland disaster co-ordination centre

props.synopsis: Australians at threat of a disaster will have to rely on text message warnings from existing state-led services, with the federal government conceding its replacement service is not yet operational.

title.children: Government concedes overdue disaster alert system not yet operational

image.altText: A man points while two other men watch on

props.synopsis: In a fiery speech filled with heckling and recriminations, Donald Trump defended his second term agenda and urged Americans bear with "a little disturbance" from his economic policies. These were the big moments of his address to a joint session of congress.

title.children: A fiery Trump spars with hecklers, speaks on Greenland, and shouts out Musk

image.altText: composite image of Elon Musk, Donald Trump and Mark Zuckerberg

props.synopsis: The uptick in showy displays of aggression and "masculine energy" across the heavyweight section of America's tycoon community is undeniable since Trump's return to power.

title.children: As Trump and his 'broligarchs' take over, reality disappears

image.altText: A man looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley had asked his wife for a divorce several months before he abruptly left his family, a court has heard.

title.children: Wife of murder accused breaks down in tears in Toyah Cordingley case

image.altText: The entrance to the Perth Children's Court at sunrise

props.synopsis: A magistrate previously called the boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, the "state's most vulnerable child".

title.children: WA mother calls for answers as 'state's most vulnerable child' missing

image.altText: a person holding a phone with a search bar showing cyclone alfred and a page about climate science

props.synopsis: Despite hundreds of thousands of accounts talking about Cyclone Alfred on Facebook, social media giant Meta was blocking or hiding search results about the impending storm before being contacted by ABC NEWS Verify.

title.children: Facebook blocked Cyclone Alfred searches and hasn't explained why

image.altText: A submerged measuring stick shows water to 0.4m.

props.synopsis: The cyclone categories only rank storms based on wind speeds, but don't take into account storm surges and flooding risks.

title.children: Why Tropical Cyclone Alfred is so dangerous

image.altText: Steve Smith directing his field against Afghanistan

props.synopsis: Steve Smith announces his retirement from one-day international cricket, following Australia's exit from the ICC Champions Trophy.

title.children: Steve Smith announces retirement from ODI cricket

image.altText: Meghan smiles as she looks to the camera in a white kitchen wearing a pastel floral blouse.

props.synopsis: Meghan's mindful lifestyle show is all about finding the joy in the little things. Of course it isn't groundbreaking. But it is the definition of an easy watch.

title.children: The world was ready to hate Meghan's new show. Was it right to?

image.altText: A bold man in black top gestures while he is speaking

props.synopsis: Self-described misogynist influencer Andrew Tate and his brother have denied raping and human trafficking allegations in Romania, saying they were "largely misunderstood".

title.children: Tate brothers hit with US criminal investigation after landing in Florida

image.altText: A woman carrying shopping bags.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy rebounds in the December quarter, with the annual rate of growth lifting to 1.3 per cent.

title.children: Australia's economy exits 21-month per capita recession

image.altText: A locked gate with a large 'no unauthorised entry' sign affixed to it.

props.synopsis: The company operating the Northern Territory's McArthur River Mine, one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has been convicted and fined for unlawful works on a sacred site spanning 13 years.

title.children: Mining giant fined for unlawful works on NT sacred site over 13 years

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: The federal government has been accused of making a "sweetheart deal" to exempt YouTube from the teen social media ban, as YouTube's competitors kick off a co-ordinated public campaign against the move.

title.children: 'Banning soft drink and exempting Coke': YouTube's rivals slam draft ban

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A large building with a red sign that says Brindabella Christian College.

props.synopsis: Brindabella Christian College enters voluntary administration in the latest instalment of the Canberra private school's long-running financial struggles.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College enters voluntary adminstration

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a house in a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Anthony Coulter Wright was told by the court that his actions had caused "excruciating and ongoing grief" to his wife's loved ones, including the children they shared.

title.children: Queensland man gets life sentence for murdering wife of 30 years

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: A former Tasmanian MP and beauty pageant winner has been found guilty of emotionally abusing and intimidating her ex-husband by a Launceston magistrate.

title.children: Former beauty queen MP guilty of decade-long emotional abuse of ex-husband

image.altText: A fire engine and truck with men in high vis gear on a road next to the bush

props.synopsis: Police allege a man charged with murdering four people had engaged in a targeted attack when he followed a car in an attempted robbery on the NSW north coast a year ago.

title.children: 'Targeted attack': Man charged with four counts of murder after crash

image.altText: An early morning shot of the rubble of a war-damaged apartment

props.synopsis: Arab leaders have endorsed Egypt's postwar plan for the Gaza Strip in a counterproposal to US President Donald Trump's plan to redevelop the region as a beach destination.

title.children: Arab leaders endorse Egypt's plan to rebuild Gaza

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and solar panels.

props.synopsis: What Macquarie's departure from a global green alliance committed to cutting emissions tells us about the future of net zero finance.

title.children: Macquarie follows major US banks out the door of climate alliance

image.altText: An adult female varroa destructor mite.

props.synopsis: Varroa destructor mite has been found in southern Queensland, the first detection of the world's worst bee-killing parasite in the state.

title.children: World's worst bee-killing parasite found in Queensland

image.altText: Bree and Kodi Nikorima pose

props.synopsis: The wife of Kodi Nikorima has slammed the NRL for prioritising the Dolphins season opening match against the Rabbitohs over the families of players in Brisbane, while Lions premiership player Lachie Neale said he would not have travelled if the AFL had relocated its game against Geelong.

title.children: 'Disgusting' NRL cyclone move slammed by Dolphin player's wife

image.altText: The outside of a mosque building with a sign for prayer.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy from WA is charged after allegedly making violent threats against a mosque in Sydney.

title.children: Parents of WA teen who allegedly threatened Sydney mosque 'horrified'

image.altText: Guy Barnett stands in front of a big painting and smiles.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government says it is creating an Efficiency and Productivity Unit — EPU — to cut down on spending. Opponents say it is a "ludicrous" copy of Elon Musk's DOGE and will mean "cuts, job freezes, outsourcing and privatisation for decades".

title.children: Tasmania's cost-cutting unit branded as 'ludicrous' copycat of Elon Musk's DOGE

image.altText: A woman sitting on a log wearing a brown top.

props.synopsis: The voices of those experiencing homelessness often go unheard. Meet three Canberrans who’ve found themselves sleeping rough. And while reasons for why differ for each, there's a common thread in how quickly and easily it happened.

title.children: 'All happened so quickly': Eileen is sleeping in her car at a Canberra park

image.altText: Justin Trudeau speaks at a press conference indoors.

props.synopsis: Justin Trudeau says further tariffs against American products will be introduced in coming weeks, labelling the trade war launched by Donald Trump as "dumb".

title.children: Canadian PM accuses Trump of using tariffs to make annexation 'easier'

image.altText: A box of tea with the Rainforest Alliance logo.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation in Sri Lanka has found popular certification schemes are failing to live up to their ethical promises.

title.children: 'Not sustainable': The heavy price your 6c tea bag is exacting on others

image.altText: A satellite image shows clouds forming a tropical cyclone off the coast of Australia

props.synopsis: Weather satellites are capturing the formation and movements of Tropical Cyclone Alfred as it approaches Queensland's south eastern coastline.

title.children: The view from space of Cyclone Alfred nearing coastline

image.altText: A yellow pistol lies on top of a tan police folder.

props.synopsis: Four men are arrested in raids at homes in Queanbeyan, Gundaroo and Nanima, with police allegedly seizing a number of items including dozens of guns, parts, ammunition and blueprints for 3D-printed firearms.

title.children: Four arrested over alleged illegal manufacturing of 3D-printed firearms

image.altText: Two grey fighter jets fly side-by-side against a blue and lightly cloudy sky

props.synopsis: The plane and its pilots lost contact during an engagement with insurgents in the country's south.

title.children: Fighter pilots and their jet lose contact during mission against insurgents

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's offer to consider sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine if a request is made has sparked warnings about Australia's capacity to assist with a major new military deployment.

title.children: Doubts raised over Australia's capacity to help with peacekeeping in Ukraine

image.altText: Hume stands at a lectern, an Australian flag beside her.

props.synopsis: Shadow Finance Minister Jane Hume pointed to Stanford Research when arguing that working from home hurt productivity. That same research found working from home part-time actually saw productivity gains.

title.children: Arguing against WFH, Hume cites research that supports hybrid work

image.altText: erence Stamp, Guy Pearce, and Hugo Weaving dazzle in the outback in Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.

props.synopsis: Drag Race star Etcetera Etcetera and legendary queen Cindy Pastel reflect on the history of the art form in Australia.

title.children: How the real person behind Priscilla Queen of the Desert became in icon
